reviewText:
This originally aired in September of 2010 and my 3 year old fell in love.  Six months later he's still asking to see it (and he acts out scenes from the movie with his Mickey Rescue Truck).

Mickey and his friends decide to have a Road Rally, and each one chooses their favorite vehicle.  Mickey drives the toon car, Donald has a train, Chip and Dale have a scooter, Minnie a bicycle, Daisy on roller skates, Pluto on a skateboard, "Piston" Pete on a scooter, Toodles on a tricycle, and Goofy...finds he has a broken bicycle.  The Professor presents him with a surprise - a rescue truck.  He tells Goofy he just needs to provide assistance to anyone who needs it.  As a side note, wonderfully, all road rally racers are wearing proper protective gear.

Pete thinks it's a race and holds up the tortoise and the hare side of the story while all the others stick together and follow Clarabell's map and instructions.  They go to the Mickey park, the desert, to Misteltoe Mountain, to the jungle, and more, solving puzzles and finding the Mickey Markers along the way.

It's all very celebratory, colorful, and fun, with great teamwork and camaraderie (even Pete joins in at the end, proving that it's about having fun together and not about winning).  The music is great and be warned...it sticks in your head!

It's really nice to have something we both love to watch that has really positive messages for my son.  There's accompanying extras on the DVD, including an interactive feature and Pluto Lends a Paw.

On the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse website, there is a fun interactive Road Rally game as well where my son spins the spinner and moves the corresponding spaces, clearing the way for the road rally.  It's all great - as colorful and fun as all the balloons that fly during the movie.

My little grandson absolutely loves this DVD! He has autism and is so excited when he sits and watches this DVD. He loves anything about cars, so this DVD is a huge hit. He has a few Mickey Mouse Clubhouse DVD's and this is the favorite.
Mickey Mouse is very big for little ones now. Apparently, the graphics and stories and songs are very well done and also very educational.

This Mickey Mouse Clubhouse DVD is a real hit with my three year old grandson!  He's watched it repeatedly.  Also, shipping was quick and the transaction with Amazon was easy and painless.
No complaints at all.
As I learned this morning, don't stand between your child and the TV while this video is on.  They love it!

This is my daughters favorite movie EVER!  Since she was a baby (almost 2 now) this is the only thing that would allow me to put her down for a few minutes.  Then Netflix took it off their list... Worst day of our lives!  Of course, I had to run onto Amazon to purchase it.  Now we're back to watching Mouse all the time.

My 2 year old is obsessed with this and it makes me hate my life. All the personality has been sucked out of the old characters you remember as they go on a road race--nope, sorry, a Road Rally in search for...a triangle bush?  C'mon now.  But you could easily miss that innuendo with all of the terrible music blaring throughput.  This soundtrack is so saccharine I need to snort Prozac to keep up. And let's not even get started on Toodles, the Pog with ears that has a sensitivity problem and feels inferior to a truck. What happened to Disney cartoons?  I hope the ghost of Walt is haunting every member of the focus group who came up with this vapid tripe.

My grandson loves trains, so much so that he had about a dozen different play sets.  We gave him this DVD, along with four others, for his 3rd birthday on Dec. 21.  He wouldn't take his eyes off of the movie!  The movie has a good story line, and my grandson is always saying, "Oh, Tootles!"
my son love it. he watches it five times a day every day. it's very educational and a fun way to learn.
I love it. It met my expectations. My daughter loves it so much and it saves me from a lot of stress cos that all she watches, makes her happy.

This Mickey Mouse Road Rally video is really quite good, featuring Mickey and Minnie, Donald and Daisy, Goofy, Ludwick Von Drake, Piston Pete and Tootles, can't forget Chip and Dale, and Henrietta Cow. The character are all using different transportation, truck, car, skateboards, bicycles, and train engine. My daughter tries to say them all when she sees them. She's watch it enough where she knows all the characters and what they are riding. Of course her favorite part is The Hot Dog Song at the end, she loves to dance the Hot Dog. As Henrietta says "its not who finishes first".
My grandchild likes this dvd very much.  She watches it all the time.  For the price, it is a good choice.

Mickey and friends go for a road rally to find certain items on a list and one of the items is a Triangle Bush!  Really?  The story couldn't have them look for something else?  My 2.5 year old boy loves the episode anyway.
it met my child's expectations and I see it as money well spent and value received for it too. I

This movie is so cute.  The race to the finish...reminds me of the tortoise and the hare with Mickey, Minnie and friends and Pete as the one who thinks he can win, so he is careless and of course you know the rest of the story...Cute and a story to be told.  Love it and would recommend.
